criteria: Identification of Signs and Symbols: Correctly identifies various safety-related signs and symbols.
Understanding of Warning Labels: Demonstrates comprehension of the information conveyed by warning labels.
Application of Safety Knowledge: Applies knowledge of signs, symbols, and labels to potential safety scenarios.
descriptions: Does not identify any safety-related signs or symbols, or provides completely incorrect identifications.
Identifies only one or two basic safety signs or symbols with limited accuracy.
Identifies some common safety signs and symbols but may confuse their meanings or purposes.
Identifies most common safety signs and symbols accurately, with minor errors or omissions.
Identifies nearly all safety signs and symbols accurately and demonstrates a good understanding of their meanings.
Accurately identifies and explains the meaning and purpose of a wide range of safety signs and symbols, including less common ones.
Shows no understanding of warning labels or their purpose.
Demonstrates a very basic understanding of warning labels, but misinterprets key information.
Understands the general purpose of warning labels but struggles with specific details or instructions.
Generally understands warning labels and can interpret basic instructions or warnings with some accuracy.
Demonstrates a clear understanding of warning labels and can accurately interpret most instructions and warnings.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of warning labels, including the ability to interpret complex information and apply it to real-world situations.
Unable to apply knowledge of safety signs, symbols, or labels to any practical scenario.
Struggles to apply safety knowledge and makes significant errors in judgment regarding safety practices.
Can sometimes apply safety knowledge to simple scenarios but demonstrates inconsistencies.
Applies safety knowledge to most common scenarios effectively but may struggle with unfamiliar situations.
Consistently applies safety knowledge to a variety of scenarios, demonstrating sound judgment.
Expertly applies safety knowledge to complex and novel scenarios, demonstrating excellent judgment and proactive safety measures.
